alert.note: Alert for Braxton; Calhoun; Clay; Gilmer; Jackson; Kanawha; Northwest Fayette; Northwest Nicholas; Northwest Webster; Roane; Southeast Nicholas; Southeast Webster (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 6:01AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Calhoun, Nicholas, eastern Kanawha, southwestern Gilmer, Braxton, Roane, southwestern Webster, Clay, southeastern Jackson and Fayette Counties through 645 AM EDT... At 600 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Gassaway to 11 miles northwest of Amma. Movement was southeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Summersville, Fayetteville, Spencer, Richwood, Sutton, Clay, Oak Hill, Sissonville, Montgomery, Mount Hope, Ansted, Clendenin, Cedar Grove, East Bank, Gassaway, Glasgow, Smithers, Gauley Bridge, Pratt and Camden-On-gauley. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 5 and 72. Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 121 and 132. West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 53 and 83. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Charleston West Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Braxton; Calhoun; Clay; Gilmer; Jackson; Kanawha; Northwest Fayette; Northwest Nicholas; Northwest Webster; Roane; Southeast Nicholas; Southeast Webster
